The Best Reusable Straws to Take With You Anywhere
We tested a dozen models to find the best options to keep in your bag.

BY MADISON FLAGER AND MEAGHAN KENNY

March 3, 2022

As more and more restaurants, coffee shops, and hotels phase out single-use plastic straws, reusable straws are becoming a must-have item on the go, both to reduce your waste and enjoy whatever cold beverage you're sipping on. Thankfully, keeping a metal or silicone straw with you is easier than ever—compact carrying cases, simple cleaning brushes, and retractable designs allow you to keep one on hand without it taking up too much space in your bag.

To find the best reusable straws to take on the road, we tested a dozen straws to make sure the ease of use, size, and mouthfeel were all just right. We went through collapsible telescopic options, silicone straws, and both straight and foldable straws, though we left out glass straws, as they seem impractical for travel.

Below, the best reusable drinking straws to bring with you anywhere, so you're never stranded with an iced coffee and no straw (or worse, a quickly disintegrating paper one).

The best collapsible straws
Top pick:
Kynup collapsible metal straws

- Of all the telescopic reusable straws tested, this was the clear favorite. It comes in a set of four, so you can keep one in every bag in your rotation or distribute amongst your family. Each one comes with a matching carabiner keychain (there are four different colors in the set), so you can attach it to a key ring, key loop, or exterior backpack strap, as well as a sturdy cleaning brush that nestles into the straw and pulls out to expand. The straws themselves are long and slim, with a removable silicone tip. Because the reusable metal straws are telescopic, you can adjust it to different lengths based on the cup you're drinking out of. It also slides in and out smoothly (some we tested were sticky or squeaky). The only minor con for me was the case itself was pretty squeaky when twisting open. —Madison Flager, commerce editor

- $15 AT AMAZON
More options we like:
Doboli portable telescopic straw

- My second favorite of the bunch came from Doboli. The stainless steel straw had a lot of the same features as the Kynup—a sturdy carabiner and key loop, an included cleaning brush, and a silicone tip (however, the tip was shorter, which made for an awkward mouthfeel). The case the straw sits in is a twist off, and takes a long time to twist closed, which sounds ridiculous, but was a differentiating enough factor to knock it down to second place. This one is super light, and just slightly lighter than the Kynup (1 ounce compared to 1.3 ounces). —M.F.

- $7 AT AMAZON
Funbiz stainless steel straws

- While thicker than the previous two (though still nearly as light), this Funbiz stainless steel straw gets the job done. Like the others, the straws are dishwasher safe, and each one comes with a carabiner and key loop, plus silicone tips to put on the end of the straw if you prefer; there are three in a set. The tapered silicone tip was a favorite of the bunch, and the extra long brush made for easy cleaning. The case is a pull to open, rather than a twist-off, and is plastic, which makes it slightly less durable than the other two. —M.F.

- $7 AT AMAZON
Eco-Pals reusable folding straw

- It's the little the things that make the difference here—these Eco-Pals straws have a telescopic opening, a long extendable cleaning brush, a keychain loop, and silicone tips to put on the end, however the tips were a bit rough (I'd forgo them for this one), and the case is bulkier than the others tested. Plus, it doesn't come with a carabiner. —M.F.

- $7 AT AMAZON
Anpro collapsible stainless steel straws

- These stainless steel straws, which come in a set of three, are in a slightly different category than the picks above, but we're still considering them collapsible: The straws come as two separate telescopic pieces that are easy to twist together to expand into one full straw. This allows the straw and its cleaning piece to fit into a small case (its about three and a half inches long), making them ideal for on the go. Keep a case in your purse or backpack so you'll always have one handy. —Meaghan Kenny, editorial assistant

- $12 AT AMAZON

The best silicone straw
Ello Impact silicone fold and store straws

- These silicone straws have become my go-to for any cold beverage. They're soft and easy to drink from and the compact case fits in any small bag (you can even clip the case to your keychain). Know that you need to fold the straws up to put them into the case, but the flexible material makes it easy to do so. The straws come in a set of six in a variety of colors and are dishwasher safe and BPA-free; one cleaning brush is included, too. —M.K.

- $13 AT AMAZON
The best portable straw
Ecotribe reusable metal straws

- These eco-friendly metal straws make every iced coffee, morning smoothie, and glass of cold water taste even better. The set of four reusable metal straws comes with two wooden cases, two cleaners, and a soft drawstring carrying case. Since the cases are on the larger side, these are my favorite to use at home in place of plastic straws. —M.K.

- $16 AT AMAZON
